body_html: I see, then I believe this line of code a = torch.from_numpy(np.zeros((0,3))) should raise an exception. Having zero-dimensional Tensors is quite convenient sometimes. I was just wondering is there any particular reason for not having them?
body_text: I see, then I believe this line of code a = torch.from_numpy(np.zeros((0,3))) should raise an exception. Having zero-dimensional Tensors is quite convenient sometimes. I was just wondering is there any particular reason for not having them?
body: I see, then I believe this line of code `a = torch.from_numpy(np.zeros((0,3)))` should raise an exception. Having zero-dimensional Tensors is quite convenient sometimes. I was just wondering is there any particular reason for not having them?
